description: Dive into "Picture-Perfect Izmir: Capture the Charm" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Picture-Perfect Izmir: Capture the Charm

places.generalDescription: The ƒ∞zmir Historical Elevator Building, also known as Tarihi Asansor or Historical Elevator Tower, is a charming historical tower located in the Karatas neighborhood of Izmir. Built in 1907 by Nesim Levi Bayraklioglu, it was designed to provide a practical solution for navigating the steep cliffs that separated the upper and lower parts of the hilly area of the city.

sources.snippet: Asans√∂r, is a historical building in Izmir's Karata≈ü quarter. It was built in 1907 as a work of public service by a wealthy Jewish banker and trader of that period, Nesim Levi Bayraklƒ±oƒülu, in order to ease passage from the narrow coastline of Karata≈ü to the hillside, the elevator within the building serving to carry people and goods through the steep cliff between the two parts of the quarter. In time, the small street that led to the building also came to be known under the same name, Asans√∂r Street (Asans√∂r Sokaƒüƒ±).
sources.shortName: Sightseeing in Izmir, Turkey | M√∂venpick Hotels & Resorts

sources.snippet: Izmir Elevator is one of Izmir's newest tourist attractions and is an important historical landmark in Caratas Square. It was built in 1907 by one of the rich people to make it easier for the inhabitants of hilly areas and high tops to reach their homes. This archaeological lift increased hillside attractions, such as restaurants and caf√©s that attract many tourists, enjoying a magnificent view of the city from those high places.
sources.shortName: Tourism in Izmir: The most beautiful tourist places in Izmir

sources.snippet: Built by a local businessman in the early 1900s to ease transportation of goods and people to the steep hills of Izmir, the elevator has become an important landmark and one of the most popular places to photograph in the city. And it is totally free of charge to use!
sources.shortName: 21 Best Things to Do in Izmir, Turkey's Third Largest City

sources.snippet: Historical Elevator is one of the popular places to visit in Izmir and is known for its Turkish name as Asans√∂r. The height of the Elevator is 58 meters. From here, you can take a panoramic view of Izmir.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in Izmir

places.name: ƒ∞zmir Historical Elevator Building

reviews.text: Great view, build 1907 by Jewish Philanthropist offers great view on city Seaside. Upstairs 2 nice Restaurants

Surprisingly there was no queue at the entrance as there was some protests going on in the city. The view is so nice. If you are not going to sit at the cafe/restaurant 10 minutes is enough to take photos and see around.

Lovely place! The view is something - for two lira, you can use the super cool binoculars, and the restaurant / bar seems to be owned by the government so prices are rather accessible. The little basket of fried things we ordered was not good, but having a cold beer under the hot Aegean sun overlooking tone water like that is not to be missed. We went down via the stairs and up via the Elevator - one can really understand why it was built üòÖ

places.address: Turgut Reis, ≈ûht. Nihatbey Cd. 76/A, 35000 Konak/ƒ∞zmir, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: The Clock Tower of ƒ∞zmir, built in 1901 to commemorate the 25th year of Sultan Abdulhamid II's reign, stands as a timeless symbol of the city. Located in Konak Square, it offers a beautiful setting by the sea with green areas and benches for visitors to relax and enjoy the vibrant atmosphere. The tower's design by M.

sources.snippet: Izmir‚Äôs famous Clock Tower is a historic edifice, built in 1901 by Levantine French architect Raymond Charles P√®re to commemorate Ottoman Sultan Abd√ºlhamid II.
sources.shortName: These Instagram Photos Will Make You Want To Visit Izmir Turkey

sources.snippet: The clock tower is one of the most prominent tourist areas in Izmir in the middle of Konak Square, 25 meters high. At the top of the tower is an antique clock, gifted by the German Emperor William II. The tower was built in 1901 to mark the 25th anniversary of Sultan Abdul Hamid II's arrival in power in the then Ottoman Empire. The Clock Tower is an attractive point for tourists to see the splendour of the building and take photos ops, and there are many entertainments around it.
sources.shortName: Tourism in Izmir: The most beautiful tourist places in Izmir

sources.snippet: Izmir Clock Tower is a historic clock tower located at the Konak Square in Konak. The clock tower was designed by the Levantine French architect Raymond Charles P√®re and built in 1901 to commemorate the 25th anniversary of Abd√ºlhamid II's accession to the throne. The clock itself was a gift from German Emperor Wilhelm II .
sources.shortName: Sightseeing in Izmir, Turkey | M√∂venpick Hotels & Resorts

sources.snippet: Somewhat lost in the modernity stands Izmir's symbol the ornate Saat Kulesi or Clock Tower. This 25 m high marble tower was designed by the Levantine French architect Raymond Charles P√©r√©. This late-Ottoman monument was built in 1901 to commemorate the 25th anniversary of Sultan Abd√ºl Hamid II's accession to the throne.
sources.shortName: Izmir, City of Homer - Images, History & Travel Tips

sources.snippet: Our first destination will be the Clock Tower which is one of the famous places to visit in Izmir. It is located in Konak Square and is the symbol of Izmir. This place, which is considered to be the central square of the city, is always full of people.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in Izmir
20 Places to Visit in Izmir, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

places.name: Clock Tower of ƒ∞zmir

reviews.text:
Izmir Clock Tower is a beautiful historic landmark in the heart of Konak Square. Even in February, the atmosphere was lively, with pigeons fluttering around and locals enjoying the area. The tower itself is an elegant piece of Ottoman architecture, especially picturesque in the evening when it's lit up.

A quick but worthwhile stop to soak in the city's charm!

It's beautiful. It is the smallest clock tower in Balkan region I think. But it is elegant and well decorated! Totally different style. It is located in the middle of the square and at the entrance of Izmir bazaar.

This is one of my favourite spots in Izmir. The clock tower is very beautiful. The area around it has benches. Ground is also present nearby when you can sit and relax. The main market is also nearby alongwith the sea. Overall a superb place to relax, enjoy with beautiful view of the tower and the sea.

places.generalDescription: Kemeraltƒ± Bazaar is a historical district in Izmir, stretching from the ancient Agora to Konak Square. It's a lively area with local shops, eateries, workshops, mosques, and more. The bazaar offers traditional Turkish handicrafts, ceramics, carpets, leather products and more in its indoor and outdoor spaces. The bustling market is the heart of Izmir's shopping scene with modern business centers, shops, cinemas and cafeterias catering to all kinds of shoppers.

sources.snippet: Turkey‚Äôs third largest city has a beautiful coast and many districts that are just as colorful as its Kemeraltƒ± Bazaar. Culture Trip rounded up some of the best Instagram posts from loyal Izmir locals who really know how to show off their city.
sources.shortName: These Instagram Photos Will Make You Want To Visit Izmir Turkey
10 Best Attractions in Izmir

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs located right in-between the Kordon and Izmir‚Äôs largest bazaar, Kemeralti, while also being by Kent Tarihi Park and the Central Bus Station. So, no where else in the city comes close to the foot traffic and activity around here during the day. Surrounding the clock tower, pigeon feeding and chasing is the activity, in addition to plenty of selfies.
sources.shortName: 7 First Impressions of Izmir, Turkey (From a Street Photography Perspective)

sources.snippet: Izmir's Kemeralti bazaar is, after Istanbul's Covered Bazaar, the second largest of Turkey and is large enough to include several city districts. The Kemeraltƒ± Bazaar is located south of the busy Fevzi Pa≈üa Bulvarƒ± that connects the Basmane railway station to the waterfront at Konak Meydanƒ±.
sources.shortName: Izmir, City of Homer - Images, History & Travel Tips
21 Best Things to Do in Izmir, Turkey's Third Largest City
10 Most Instagrammable Places in ƒ∞zmir Province

places.name: Kemeraltƒ± Bazaar

reviews.text:
I visited that bazaar. So beautiful, large. People so kind. But some of shop scammed me. He charged price for me. Anyway. They have problems with toilet. Only 1 toilet and it cost 15 tl.
Stuff is not cheap. The same price as the other local shops.
On the pic it's restaurant. I went to their toilet for a while and waiter just took all my orders before i finished. Although I warned them not to touch it, that I would be back.

This place is huge. One can find anything from printing service to suits and souvenirs. Of course there are a lot of restaurants and cafes. There is no need to visit every corner of it. Maybe just casually stroll and see where one is lead to.

We visited Kemeraltƒ± Bazaar on a Saturday - it was quite crowded but had a lively and authentic atmosphere. The bazaar is extensive and offers almost everything: clothing, accessories, fixtures, sweets, butchers, restaurants, and more. A great place to experience local culture and shop for a wide variety of items in ƒ∞zmir.

places.generalDescription: K√ºlt√ºrpark is a beloved spot for locals in Izmir, offering a serene escape from the bustling city. The park boasts a tranquil walking and running path shaded by trees, providing a peaceful environment for exercise and relaxation. Visitors can also enjoy the expansive green spaces for activities such as stretching or simply unwinding. Additionally, the park is home to the Ataturk Open Air Theater, hosting various live performances including music, ballet, modern dance, and theater shows.

sources.shortName: Izmir, City of Homer - Images, History & Travel Tips

places.name: K√ºlt√ºrpark ƒ∞zmir

reviews.text: Kulturpark ƒ∞zmir is a large, historic urban park in ƒ∞zmir, Turkey, covering around 420,000 square meters. Established in 1936, it serves as a central cultural and recreational space, hosting the ƒ∞zmir International Fair, museums, theaters, an art center, and a zoo. The park features scenic walking paths, botanical gardens, and sports facilities, making it a lively destination for cultural events and daily relaxation for locals and visitors alike.

K√ºlt√ºrpark is a beautiful green oasis in the heart of Izmir, offering a peaceful escape from the city's hustle and bustle. The park is spacious, with plenty of walking paths, shaded areas, and seating, making it perfect for a relaxing stroll or a family outing. There are also nice ponds, playgrounds, and cultural venues, which add to its charm.

However, it's clear that the park could use more maintenance. Some areas feel a bit neglected, and a little more care would truly bring out its full potential. Despite that, it's still a lovely place to spend a few hours and connect with nature. It's definitely worth a visit if you're in the area!

Here is quite different comparing to normal kulture park in Turkey. There are many buildings in the park here. As a foreigner, it's little bit confused. But peaceful park. But there  is no something special.

places.address: Mimar Sinan, ≈ûair E≈üref Blv. No.50, 35220 Konak/ƒ∞zmir, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: The Arkas Art Center, located in Izmir, is a cultural gem that houses the impressive Arkas Collection. This collection, curated by Lucien Arkas, features a diverse array of art from both Turkish and international artists. Housed in a historic building, the center showcases paintings, sculptures, carpets, armor, and glass objects that offer insight into various historical periods and global regions. Additionally, the center in Alsancak serves as a dynamic space for exhibitions and cultural events.

sources.snippet: If you are fond of art, then you should include the Art Center ARKAS in your list of places to go in Izmir. The two-story art center consists of 9 exhibition halls and a studio, where you can see a permanent exhibition of paintings of the 19th-20th century and temporary art and archaeological exhibitions. The Arkas Art Center is a 10-minute walk from the Ataturk Museum.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Izmir

places.name: Arkas Sanat Merkezi

reviews.text: It's a small art gallery in a historic building near the sea promenade, where you can find nice exhibitions of Turkish artists. Usually it is free entrance. Highly recommended.

The Art Center embraces sustainable design principles, incorporating green roofs, energy-efficient systems, and environmentally conscious materials. With its green carpet rising from the city park to the sea, the center not only provides a visually stunning addition to the cityscape but also offers a vibrant and adaptable space that celebrates the convergence of art, culture, and the natural environment.

Designed by Tuncer Cakmakli Architects
Amazing Art center with free exhibitions. This is a part of the French consulate which sits across the road. The building itself is astounding!

places.address: Fransa Sokak, Alsancak, 1380 . Sk. No:1, ƒ∞zmir, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Kordon Alsancak Izmir is a picturesque waterfront walkway that stretches from Alsancak to Konak, offering stunning views of the sea and plenty of opportunities for relaxation. The area is lined with cafes, museums, and galleries, making it a popular spot for both locals and tourists. Visitors can enjoy sitting on the grassy areas along the path or even find stone seats to dangle their feet over the edge. It's an ideal place for people-watching and sunset viewing.

sources.snippet: ƒ∞zmir's iconic seafront stretches north from Cumhuriyet Meydanƒ± to Alsancak and south from Konak Pier to Konak Meydanƒ±. These stretches are surrounded by bars and restaurants with walking and cycling paths next to grassed areas. It truly is a lovely place to hang out and meet up with your friends especially during sunset.
sources.shortName: Top ƒ∞zmir Attractions - 10 places you can't miss in ƒ∞zmir

sources.snippet: Visit Izmir Kordon, a lively waterfront promenade stretching along the Aegean Sea. This area brims with cafes, restaurants, and parks, offering visitors a place to unwind. Stroll along the tree-lined paths, soak up the stunning sea views, and savour Turkish coffee while enjoying the serene sunset.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Izmir, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: I can‚Äôt imagine Izmir without its Kordon, the long seaside promenade always full of life. It‚Äôs an icon of the city and what really makes Izmir special. Stretching 6 km from Alasancak down to Konak Meydanƒ±, it passes by popular spots like Cumhuriyet Square and Konak Pier.
sources.shortName: 7 First Impressions of Izmir, Turkey (From a Street Photography Perspective)

places.name: Kordon Alsancak Izmir

reviews.text:
Here is the first place i visited during my first visit in ƒ∞zmir city. This beach in ƒ∞zmir is a true gem! The crystal-clear turquoise water, soft golden sand, and stunning views make it a perfect spot to relax and enjoy nature. The beach is well-maintained.  There is an amazing place to walk along the beach and enjoy the fantastic view.

The surrounding area offers a great selection of cafes and restaurants serving delicious local dishes and refreshing drinks. Parking is convenient, and the access to the beach is well-marked and easy to navigate. I saw many people had come to fish.

It's an ideal place for families, couples, and even solo travelers looking for a serene escape. Highly recommend visiting during weekdays to avoid crowds and fully enjoy the tranquility. Can't wait to return!

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Kordon in Alsancak is beautifully maintained and ideal for a scenic seaside walk. The area is clean, with plenty of benches to sit and enjoy the view. It's also conveniently located near caf√©s, restaurants, and other services. We truly enjoyed our time there - a peaceful and refreshing part of ƒ∞zmir.

Alexander Calder's sculpture on ƒ∞zmir's First Kordon is a striking addition to the city's waterfront, blending dynamic movement with monumental presence. True to Calder's signature style, the piece features a bold, abstract form with delicate, suspended elements that sway with the wind, creating a mesmerizing interplay of balance and motion. Its organic curves and sharp angles echo both natural and mechanical influences, standing as a testament to Calder's mastery of kinetic art. Positioned against the backdrop of the Aegean Sea, the sculpture transforms with the shifting light and breeze, making it not just a static monument but a living part of the landscape. This installation enriches ƒ∞zmir's cultural fabric, offering both locals and visitors a contemplative and ever-changing visual experience.

places.generalDescription: Agora √ñren Yeri, located in Izmir, is an open-air museum showcasing the remains of an ancient Greek and Roman market and city center. Dating back to the end of the 4th century BC, this historical site was ruined by an earthquake in AD 178 but was soon rebuilt under the orders of Roman emperor Marcus Aurelius.

sources.snippet: In Roman times, agoras were public spaces as well as a city‚Äôs administrative and commercial centre. This 4th century site is located on Kadifekale (Pagos) Hill. It is made up of grassy open space enclosed by ancient columns and brick foundations.
sources.shortName: Top ƒ∞zmir Attractions - 10 places you can't miss in ƒ∞zmir

places.name: Agora √ñren Yeri

reviews.text: This historic site is absolutely worth visiting! Rich in cultural heritage and stunning architecture, it offers a fascinating glimpse into the past. The well-preserved ruins and informative exhibits make it both educational and visually captivating. Whether you're a history enthusiast or simply exploring, the site's timeless charm leaves a lasting impression. Don't miss this unforgettable journey through history!
Archeological area is interesting but there is only a limited area that you can visit. Very nice the architecture of the remaining buildings, but most of agora is destroyed.

I think Agora √ñren Yer is an absolute gem! The ancient ruins are breathtaking, and the history is palpable. Walking through the streets and marketplace, you can almost imagine life in ancient times. The scenery is stunning, with beautiful views and well-preserved architecture. A must-visit for history buffs and anyone looking for a glimpse into the past. Highly recommend! üèØüëè

places.address: Namazgah, Tarik Sari Sokaƒüƒ± No:29, 35240 Konak/ƒ∞zmir, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Konak Pier is a historic seaside building located in Izmir, originally designed by Gustave Eiffel. It has been repurposed into an upscale shopping, dining, and cinema complex. The pier houses boutique shops, high-end restaurants with white linen tablecloths, and a movie theater. Visitors can also find English books at the bookstore and enjoy pleasant outdoor seating at cafes like Starbucks while watching the seagulls on the water.

sources.snippet: Stretching 6 km from Alasancak down to Konak Meydanƒ±, it passes by popular spots like Cumhuriyet Square and Konak Pier. The whole way, though, you‚Äôll pass through plenty of life and interest. You‚Äôll find long stretches of grass that fill with locals enjoying each others company, especially towards the end of the day, as it‚Äôs the city‚Äôs main meeting spot for relaxation.
sources.shortName: 7 First Impressions of Izmir, Turkey (From a Street Photography Perspective)

sources.snippet: Designed in the 19th century by the famous French architect Gustave Eiffel as a customs house, Konak Pier is a shopping centre on the waterfront just north of Konak Square. Here, among other things, you can find many shops, cinemas and a bookshop where you can even find books written in English.
sources.shortName: Top ƒ∞zmir Attractions - 10 places you can't miss in ƒ∞zmir

sources.snippet: Discover Konak Pier, an iconic seafront complex designed by Gustave Eiffel. Once a customs building, it now hosts upscale shops, restaurants, and a cinema. This historic landmark is located near Konak Square in ƒ∞zmir and blends old-world charm with modern appeal.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Izmir, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: With shops and a number of sea-facing restaurants, Konak Pier is a great place to enjoy a coffee or a meal with friends. Enjoy some authentic Turkish dishes such as baked mantƒ± (Turkish-style ravioli), with the view of the mountains of Izmir.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Things to Do in Izmir, Turkey's Third Largest City

places.name: Konak Pier

reviews.text: This is a great place. Security check to get in, and then a hub of cafe culture, whilst also being an active ferry port. Very pretty place.

Cool concept and interesting that it was designed by Eiffel but it was a bit of a let down since it was not air conditioned in the main mall hallway so stifling hot (100+F day) and the only access to the waterfront was through restaurants. Many shops are vacant but the clothing ones seemed very nice.

Konak Pier is a shopping and dining center located in a historic building overlooking the ruins of the old port. The place has been beautifully transformed into a charming tourist destination that houses restaurants and commercial markets.

places.address: Pier AVM, Konak, Atat√ºrk Cd. No:19, 35260 Konak/ƒ∞zmir, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Konak Square, situated between the neighborhoods of Alsancak and Cankaya in Konak, is a significant landmark in Izmir. At its center stands the Ataturk Monument, a tribute to Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, the first president of Turkey. This square holds historical significance as it commemorates the Turkish War of Independence. It's not only a place for relaxation and socializing but also offers insights into the country's history.

sources.snippet: This glorious square is located between the neighbourhoods of Alsancak and √áankaya in Konak. In the middle of the square is Atat√ºrk Monument, a statue of the first president of the Turkish republic Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk atop a horse in dedication to the Turkish War of Independence from 1919-23 which culminated in the creation of the country. This is a great place to relax with friends as well as learn about the country in which you‚Äôre living.
sources.shortName: Top ƒ∞zmir Attractions - 10 places you can't miss in ƒ∞zmir

places.name: Ataturk Konak Square

reviews.text: Visited many times now and it's just as special as the first time I came. Such a great Turkish atmosphere with local folks and foreigners too. Love buying food for the pigeons from the old Turkish men. Spectacular architecture. This place has taken a place in my heart for sure. 10/10
It's an amazing place, not only with the clock tower. Right next to it is a beautiful mosque, a park, a place for walks. A few steps to get to the sea. A must-see in Izmir

The field is old Ottoman and strange at the same time and there are a lot of foreign tourists and Turks and the courtyard filled with pigeons you can feed pigeons .. As the field close to the pier and close to the markets and bazaars filled with everything that comes to mind of the creativity of the Turks where cafes, restaurants and many more  Of Turkish hotels and markets were a special visit.

places.generalDescription: Ace Asansor, located in the Konak area of Izmir, is a historic elevator built in 1907 to transport goods and people up a steep hill. The building itself is unique, but the real attraction is the panoramic view from the top. The company has expert staff and uses high-quality materials with fast after-sales service. They are known for their diligence and supervision, especially evident after winning trust by checking all systems in Izmir one by one following an earthquake.

sources.snippet: The Asans√∂r is a picturesque elevator in the heart of ƒ∞zmir that provides breathtaking views of the city. Originally constructed as a means for inhabitants to access the hilltop area, the elevator has subsequently become a popular tourist attraction. The stunning vistas from the summit make it a must-see for every Instagram-worthy trip to ƒ∞zmir.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Instagrammable Places in ƒ∞zmir Province

places.name: Ace Asansor

reviews.text: Five star company with Five star people are involved in it.

(Translated by Google) ACE elevators is one of the experienced companies in Izmir. Both company managers and field teams are experts in the field and you can receive service without any problems in the supply and installation processes.

(Original)
ACE asans√∂rleri ƒ∞zmir in deneyimli firmalarƒ±ndan birisidir. Gerek firma y√∂neticileri gerekse saha ekipleri i≈üin uzmanƒ± olup tedarik ve montaj s√ºre√ßlerinde sorun olmadan hizmet alabilirsiniz

(Translated by Google) On March 7, I requested a service appointment from the support line for a general check of our elevator and a detailed spare part offer for our worn-out panel. First of all, they asked me for the annual control report of the elevator. I notified them the next day (March 8) and they told me that they would call me back for a service appointment during the day... I waited until noon on March 9, and no one called again, this time I called again and they apologized and stated that they could not call back due to the busy week and postponed it until next week. And so far "3 weeks have passed" and no one has called or asked...

(Original)
7 Mart tarihinde destek hattƒ±ndan, asans√∂r√ºm√ºz√ºn genel kontrol√ºn√ºn yapƒ±lmasƒ± ve eskiyen panomuz i√ßin detaylƒ± yedek par√ßa teklifi verilmesi hususunda servis randevusu talebinde bulundum, benden √∂ncelikle asans√∂r√ºn yƒ±llƒ±k kontrol raporunu istediler. ertesi g√ºn ( 8 Mart ) kendilerine ilettim ve bana g√ºn i√ßerisinde servis randevusu i√ßin geri d√∂n√º≈ü yapƒ±lacaƒüƒ±nƒ± ilettiler...  9 mart tarihinde √∂ƒülene kadar bekledim,  ve yine arayan olmadƒ±, bu sefer tekrar ben aradƒ±m ve √∂z√ºr dilediler ve hafta yoƒüunluƒüundan dolayƒ± d√∂nemediklerini ver haftaya ertelediklerini beilrttiler. ve bug√ºne kadar " tam 3 hafta ge√ßti " ne arayan var ne soran..

places.address: Akdeniz, ≈ûht. Fethi Bey Cd. No:27 D:6, 35210 Konak/ƒ∞zmir, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Kadifekale, also known as the Castle of Kadifekale, is a centuries-old fort located on top of Kadifekale hill in Izmir. Originally built for the ancient Greek town of Smyrna, it offers stunning panoramic views of the harbor and the surrounding area. While the property features castle gates, walls, and various ruins, it is not well-maintained.

sources.shortName: 21 Best Things to Do in Izmir, Turkey's Third Largest City

places.name: Kadifekale

reviews.text: Free of entrance. However, I would be willing to pay the ticket to come visiting this castle if the fee help maintain or clean up this place. A lot of broken bottles and rubbish here üò¢ I don't know why people litter at such an important place. We took Uber up here because it's not easy at all to walk up the hill, not to mention to get lost if you don't know Turkish. However, it's easy to walk along the stairs and the road following the Google map. You can see the walls in ruins and also the water storage in Byzantine period, similar to the one in the city of Izmir. I notice on the map a museum is right by the castle. But  it doesn't seem open or existing anyone. Overall, Kadifekale is very nice to visit and quite potential if this place can be maintained well and advised properly for tourists. üëç‚úÖüéâ

It would be amazing if the citadel would be remade and taken care of. Right now, it's like an open air museum, but you cannot not notice the amount of rubbish that exists hidden here, when you look more closely, you will see that most of the walls right now are closed(climbing on them is forbidden at least, so you can't actually go and take a panoramic picture of Izmir) and there is an open market (grocery store) inside the antic citadel.

The place itself is great.

It needs a massive tidy up

Rubbish everywhere.
The castle walls on top have rubbish.
There is dry long grass ,fire hazzard.
The cistern has rubbish inside it .
All needs a major clean thru.

I love the antiquity of it and it's a shame the local authority don't get this organized.

places.generalDescription: In Izmir, the Atat√ºrk monument is a prominent attraction among the city's extensive landscape. Situated near Kadifekale Mountain and Velvet Castle, this monument stands as a symbol of national pride. The 42-meter high relief sculpture of M.Kemal Atat√ºrk is not only the tallest in Turkey but also ranks as the tenth highest in the world.

sources.snippet: Atat√ºrk Monument is a war memorial dedicated to the founder of modern Turkey, Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk. It is considered to be the Republic square in Izmir, and people from all across the world frequent over here to pay their homage to Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Izmir, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

places.name: Atat√ºrk monument

reviews.text: Looking great this monument. Too much biggest and strong. This national president.üëç

Monument of Mustafa Kemal Ataturk. It's large concrete bust, but it looks like it's carved in the stone of that mountain / hill. It is located in Buca district in the city of Izmir. It's best visible from highway, from where I took photos. They say it was constructed in 2009, and rennovated in 2018. Mustafa Kemal Ataturk was army general and founder of Turkey republic and modern turkish state.

"Peace at home peace in the world." M.KEMAL ATAT√úRK
The Atat√ºrk Mask, at 42 m (138 ft) high, is the highest relief sculpture in Turkey, and the tenth highest relief sculpture in the world.

places.generalDescription: Hisar Mosque, built between 1592 and 1598, is a significant landmark in Izmir. It boasts a stunning mix of Ottoman and European-style art within its domed interior. The mosque complex is intricately decorated and features a circular stone minaret along with a large central dome surrounded by seven smaller domes. Situated in the heart of the city center, it was once the largest mosque in Izmir during Ottoman times.

sources.snippet: Hisar Mosque is one of the oldest mosques in the city and one of the most famous tourist places in Izmir. It dates back to the 16th century AD, built in Ottoman style on a huge area close to the city centre. The mosque features a circular stone minaret and a large central dome, surrounded by seven smaller domes.
sources.shortName: Tourism in Izmir: The most beautiful tourist places in Izmir

sources.snippet: Hisar Mosque is the largest centre of Islamic gathering in Izmir, and the interior of this mosque is quintessentially beautiful. It was built in 1597, and it is one of the most splendid examples of Ottoman architecture.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Izmir, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

places.name: Hisar Mosque

reviews.text: Stunning mosque with many worshippers, so far these is only mosque in Izmir I have seen with many people

I don't know what you expected from a mosque. All of them in Turkey are beautiful. This mosque is located in the old bazaar in Izmir, and you can enjoy the old vibes too.üïåüáπüá∑ #mosque #izmir #travel #beautiful #architecture #history #culture
A must see place in the heart of Didim. A historical structure. Formerly a Church,  today a mosque.

places.generalDescription: Dario Moreno Sokaƒüƒ±, situated at the entrance to the Historical Elevator, is a charming street that captivates tourists visiting Izmir. Lined with vibrant cafes, restaurants, and colorful establishments, it exudes the city's unique energy. Often hailed as a must-visit in Izmir, this favorite street allures visitors with its romantic ambiance and cozy atmosphere. With inviting outdoor cafe seating and picturesque spots for photo opportunities, it offers a delightful experience.

sources.snippet: The street where Italian-born Turkish guitarist, pianist, and actor Dario Moreno once lived is now named after the artist and is under protection. Dario Moreno Street exudes a fascinating and nostalgic atmosphere with its historical texture and architecture.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Attractions in Izmir

places.name: Dario Moreno Sokaƒüƒ±

reviews.text: Colorful street with cozy places and exciting designs to enjoy your time. Even being helpful with tourists there for taking photos.
Pleasant street leading up to Asens√∂r, with many bars on either side.

BE CAREFUL. Google Maps send you ALL THE WAY UP by the stairs and you realise (once you're at the top) there's a MUCH EASY WAY to go up (by getting the lift of course or using a more gentle street to go up). The adjacent park to the lift is closed so nothing to enjoy but a coffee or a snack. hundred of HIGH stairs in all the neighborhood

places.generalDescription: Izmir Birds Paradise, located in √áiƒüli just 30 km from Izmir city center, is a renowned destination for birdwatching enthusiasts. Spanning over 8 thousand hectares, this sanctuary is home to an impressive 288 bird species and serves as a crucial migration route for birds. Visitors can easily access the area by car and have the option to rent bikes for exploring its extensive trails.

sources.snippet: The fourth destination is Izmir Bird Paradise which is famous for flamingos located in Cigli, 30 km from Izmir city centre. It hosts 288 bird species on an area of 8 thousand hectares. This area, which is one of the migration routes of birds, is among the places where nature lovers can have a pleasant time here.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in Izmir

places.name: ƒ∞zmir Birds Paradise

reviews.text: Easily accessed by car. A perfect place for kids and adults and their bikes. Once you get there you can rent a bike (for adults) or walk. Kilometers and kilometers of walking or biking trails. There is a little snack shop that is rarely open, but you can bring your own snacks as long as you don't leave trash behind. We love this place to enjoy a stroll or bike ride in nature without any cars around and no crowds, not to mention the flamingos. Such a special place.

We stopped by here after visiting Izmir Zoo, you don't need to pay or stop, just drive down the road and you will see hundreds of flamingoes in the water fields.
Watch out for the damaged road!

it used to be a wonderful place and the name paradise for this place was the right one! I used to go there frequently and there were few people, it was quiet and cleaner. March 2025 and total disappointment!!! It is now a huge garbage bin for people who visit this place, eat and drink and then leave their garbage there! I couldn't believe my eyes when I saw the amount of garbage there and you can find anything there!! plastic bottles of water, seeds, cans of beer, wipe towels, clothing items, shopping bags, etc!! Pity really! People who do not care about the nature and municipality who doesn't clean the area! Shame!

places.generalDescription: Asans√∂r, situated in the Old Jewish Quarter of Karatas, is a must-visit historical elevator offering breathtaking panoramic views of the city and bay from its top. Constructed in 1907 by a prosperous Jewish banker to facilitate access between the seaside area and hillside neighborhoods, it has become a popular attraction.

sources.snippet: This elevator in the Karata≈ü neighborhood south of Konak was built in 1907 by a wealthy Jewish banker and trader, Nesim Levi Bayraklƒ±oƒülu. Thanks to its location, the historical Elevator is the best structure to view the city from. The upper promenade of the elevator has a cafe and a restaurant in which visitors can relax and get an unparalleled view of the Gulf of ƒ∞zmir.
sources.shortName: Top ƒ∞zmir Attractions - 10 places you can't miss in ƒ∞zmir

sources.snippet: An old elevator that connects the lower and upper parts of the city is one of the main attractions of Izmir. On a 58 m height, there is a beautiful terrace with spectacular views of the Aegean Sea and coastal urban areas. There is also a nice restaurant that serves national cuisine.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Izmir

places.name: Asans√∂r

reviews.text:
Asans√∂r is a must-visit spot in Izmir, offering stunning panoramic views of the city and the coastline. The historic elevator ride itself is short but charming, and once at the top, you're greeted with a breathtaking lookout that's perfect for photos, especially at sunset.

The area around Asans√∂r has a nostalgic feel, with old streets and a few nice caf√©s nearby to sit and soak in the view. Best of all, the elevator is free to use, making it an easy and worthwhile stop while exploring the city. If you're in Izmir, it's definitely worth a visit!

Very nice structure, worth visiting. Don't miss while in ƒ∞zmir. No long waiting but still has small line. View from the top is priceless. Have good time upthere and don't rush getting down. Wonder a little up the hill and try having more different views.

Recently visited Asans√∂r, it is free to use! The views are amazing, myself and husband we have actually walked down to it, the streets above has beautiful views and also when you take the asansor to go down, it has nice little cafes. At the top of the asansor it has a nice restraunt with good prices, service wasn't great however we paid only 450tl for a slice of cake, 2 scoops of ice cream, cold latte, limonata and water. The views ate amazing so it is worth a visit.
